items.title: Enter Key Not Working Activate Pitch Bend Range Typein

labels.name: UX
labels.description: Issues related to user experience (UX) - mouse, touch, keyboard, MIDI inputs, etc.

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

labels.name: Accessibility
labels.description: Issues related to making Surge more accessible

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
Pressing enter/return on the keyboard does not activate the typein on either the up or down fields of the pitch bend range controls.
**Surge XT Version**
This information is found on the About screen, which you get to from the bottom right menu.
1.3.nightly.d64fdde
* Version:
* Plugin Type: [VST2, VST3, AU]
* Bitness: [32-bit or 64-bit]
VST3 64-bit
**Reproduction Steps:**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to any of the pitch bend controls
2. Try to press enter or/return to activate the typein
3. Note that it only produces the default OS beep (if any) but does not activate the typein

**Expected Behavior:**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
Pressing enter should activate the typein.
**Screenshots:**
If applicable, add screenshots/GIF/videos to help explain your problem.

**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: [e.g. Windows 10]
 - Host: [e.g. Bitwig, Logic, Cubase, Reaper]
 - Version: [e.g. 2.4]
Windows 11; Reaper 7.06
**Additional Information:**
Add any other context about the problem here.

Closes #6834 (hopefully!)

@Andreya-Autumn Please test! :)

items.title: userDataPathValid, and response thereto
items.body:
userDataPathvalid is a new bool on storage. We read it to at least block some obvious not-working things in the UI crudely.

Could be better, but a better solution for these suers is to get a writable documents directory! This is just avoiding crashes.

items.title: %DOCUMENTS% on windows

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: New feature request

labels.name: Infrastructure
labels.description: Issues related to repository, CI/CD, installers, etc.

items.title: Error handling when you cant open a patch etc
items.body:
Symlink scan on startup and fail ot open patch all pop an error. moreover the error mesages protect against getting hidden on rebuilds.

Closes #7547

items.title: Different recovery path for hosed %DOCUMENTS%
items.body:
Seems OneDrive can hose down %DOCUMENTS% on windows enough that more people were getting the error that the folder cant resolve. This sucks and those systems are misconfigured.

But with these changes we actually can start surge with a clear error that says saving and the like wont work. The synth kinda works also

Addresses #7544

items.title: Fix a Symlink Scannign error
items.body:
If a patch was a symlink to a missing patch, the modtime scan at startup to rebuild the patch db would throw an uncaught filesystem exception. Catch it and compensate.

Closes #7547

items.title: Revisioned Pathes broswer

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: New feature request

items.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe!**
I find the "menu based" patches browser unconfortable. His efficiency is depending on how many patches it have to shows, the screen size (as the menus floats around "out" of the plugin windows) and also with limited "filtering" capabilities.

**Describe the solution you'd like:**
Since one picture is worting 1000 words (and my english is bad) here's how I would envision it:

![image](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/9556348/530ef79b-55b2-4f35-a14a-f5155b48a1a7)

Nothing new, really, other plugins do the browsing in a similar way.
The "buttons" on the top allows to pick what you want, the leftmost column will be useful just for the 3rd party, then all the available categories (depending on what's picked on the leftmost column), then all the patches in the categories, with a scrollbar to go down.

As SurgeXT already indexes the patches (for the Search feature) i think that a browser like that could be feasible.

items.title: Wrong patches menu items when a folder contains more than 256 patches

labels.description: Issues related to UI look&feel

labels.name: Bug Report

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
When a folder in the user patches contains more that 256 patches, the patch browser mangles the folder name, spitting it in multiple menu items, loosing charachters in the way
(sorry, hard to explain for my poor english)

This is a screenshot of my "Leads" patches folder:
![image](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/9556348/722d2744-1bd3-48a8-98b0-534523d58ff3)
it shows 396 elements.

This is how it appears in SurgeXT:
![image](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/9556348/16756372-2bf0-4bb2-9adf-476cc3f28162)
You can see there's a "_eads_" and a "_ads_" menu item, where there should be a "**_Leads_**" one.
(this also happens for "**_Basses_**" and "**_Pads_**", in this picture)

Going on "_eads_" it shows the first 256 patches, and in "_ads_" the remaining ones:
![image](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/9556348/52e1b17b-17bb-423d-a157-912e841dbb44)
![image](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/9556348/07ca4f63-86dc-4c5c-ae51-0fd09f1f02fb)



**Surge XT Version**
![image](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/9556348/95b4ffc9-bf3f-4d75-a433-ae61f188fdd1)

items.title: Fatal Error with missed symlinked fxp preset, causes the DAW to crash to desktop

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
In order to have all the patches organized by category, i've symlinked all the factory and 3rdparty pathces in the User patches
(so it contains folders like "Basses", "Pads", "keys" etc. with all the presets ssymlinked inside).
Due to an error in the batch file i've made to do that, one link is pointing to an inexistent file.

When Surge XT browses the user patches folder this results in a fatal error and it closes.
If it was the VST in my DAW (FLStudio) the DAW crashes to desktop.
If instead it was the SurgeXT standalone, it produces the attached screenshot.

* Version:
Plugin Type: VST3 64-bit

**Expected Behavior:**
I think it SurgeXT should handle the problem more gracefull. ignoring the "bad" patch (missing the file in this case) and not listing it, or maybe showing it in a different way in the patces broswer.
Anyway, it should not close and cause the DAW to crash.

**Screenshots:**
![image](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/9556348/e68400a0-a5f8-47e9-ac16-6a73728e9f7d)

 - Windows 10
 - Host: Any, the standalone version also

Closes #7529

items.title: Cli main small fixes
Invert cli log level logic
items.body: It is normally expected the incoming log level, via parameter or configuration, to dictate how the current the set of log msgs are to be shown. If cli in invoked with VERBOSE or TRACE level, all msgs up to that level are shown. Otherwise, if it is said to be BASIC, only msgs with such level should be displayed.

items.title: Upgrade CMakeLists.txt to 1.3.2
Release checklist for Surge XT 1.3.2
items.body:
Release label: XT 1.3.2
Link to milestone: https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/milestone/34

## Pre-Install

- [ ] Address all open issues for the milestone
- [ ] Update the changelog
- [ ] Update the manual
- [x] Make sure the `CMakeLists.txt` version matches the version you are about to install

## Executing the Install

- [x] Update `releases-xt/azure-pipelines` so we don't get a tag conflict when the release happens even if it is just a bump commit
- [ ] Create git markers in the `surge` repository
  - [ ] Unlock your GPG key just in case, by running `gpg --output x.sig --sign CMakeLists.txt`
  - [ ] Create a branch named `git checkout -b release-xt/1.3.2`
  - [ ] Sign a tag with `git tag -s release_xt_1.3.2 -m "Create signed tag"`,
  - [ ] Push both the branch and tag to upstream `git push --atomic upstream-write release-xt/1.3.2 release_xt_1.3.2`

## Post-Install

- [ ] Update and announce
   - [ ] Update Homebrew [doc](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/tree/master/doc)
   - [ ] Update [Winget manifest](https://github.com/microsoft/winget-pkgs) (`wingetcreate update --submit --urls https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/releases-xt/releases/download/1.3.2/surge-xt-win64-1.3.2-setup.exe --version x.y.z SurgeSynthTeam.SurgeXT`)
   - [ ] Ping @luzpaz in https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/issues/7132
   - [ ] Post to KvR thread, Facebook, Discord, etc.

items.title: Step Sequencer Typein returns focus to step
items.body:
When doing a step sequencer edit as text focus thingy the focus would return to top of sequencer, which wasn't useful. Set a return target and make it the step which launched the edit.

Closes #7521

items.title: Add an option (-DSURGE_SKIP_WERROR=True) to skip -Werror
items.body:
Some build environments have compilers, toolchains, or other oddities which mean -Werror doesn't work. Rather than have those distros patch, add a cmake option which we don't set in CI but you can at home!

Closes #7509

items.title: Send MTS-ESP Master Tunings without UI
items.body:
An oversight, we only refreshed tunings if the surge UI was open. This meant saved sessions where the UI didn't open would not provide scales properly.

Addresses #7523. Would like confirmatino before we close that though.

items.title: Initfm2 fix
items.body:
-Enable WS/filters in FM2 template
-Make octaves in Env/Osc same for both scenes

items.title: Set tuning radial 'stretch' lower bound to 100cents
items.body:
you can't dial-stretch the repetition interval for the entire scale below 100cents using the spinny knob, which used to be unbounded and would explode you.

Closes #7530

items.title: Global (so SLFO -> Effect) modulators use index correctly
items.body: Global (SLFO->Effect for instance) modulations ignored the source index in the routing table, always picking index 0. This meant, for instance, an indexed formula modulator couldn't modulate an effect reliably (it always picked output 0) and also things like env/wav would not work on regular lfos. Also fix edge case with formula to mseg overlay swap Fix an edge-case crash in Formula Modulator Debugger on MSEG Swap

items.title: Fix an edge-case crash in Formula Modulator Debugger on MSEG Swap
items.body: They 'keep the overlay open' code was incorrectly creating a temporary formula overlay when closing the formula overlay in switch to mseg mode which crashed the debugger. Fix.

items.title: Formula LFOs behave differently if they have more than one output

labels.name: Modulation
labels.description: Modulation related issues

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
I tried to create some kind of vocal sounds by filtering noise through an equalizer added to the insert FX chain. It should emphasize two frequencies from [this Wikipedia table](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Formant#Phonetics).

To allow switching between the vowels, I wrote lua scripts. In the attached patch [Formant Filter Basic_bug.zip](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/files/14406956/Formant.Filter.Basic_bug.zip) the desired vowel is selected by Macro 1 (named "Vowel Select"). 

In scene A, S-LFO1 contains code to calculate the first frequency for the equalizer, S-LFO2 code for the second frequency.

In scene B, S-LFO1 contains code to calculate both frequencies.

All the scripts are nearly identical except for the final output. All other settings are identical between the scenes, so theoretically both scenes should generate the same sound but they don't do this.

**Surge XT Version**
* Version: 1.3.1
* Plugin Type: Standalone
* Bitness: 64-bit

**Reproduction Steps:**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Load the attached patch
2. Play a note with scene A set
3. Compare to same note with scene B

**Expected Behavior:**
Same sound generated by both scenes.


**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: Windows 7 64bit

items.title: Saving tempo value in current patch

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: New feature request

labels.name: Standalone
labels.description: Issues pertaining to Surge standalone application and CLI (command line interface)

items.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe!**
I'm only using Surge XT _**standalone version**_ (thx for doing it too, besides the plugin ones).
My problem is that when I'm loading a patch for a song, I've always have to set the tempo of the song manualy (on the left side of the virtual keyboard of Surge).
After a fresh start, Surge XT standalone always set the tempo at 120 bpm. This value seems to be hard coded since I could not find in any config file a way to set another default (or start up) value.


**Describe the solution you'd like:**
I would like that Surge saves the current tempo value in the current loaded patch when I'm saving/overwritting it.
When used as a DAW plugin, Surge XT could simply ignore this parameter of the patch, since Surge should receive the current tempo value from the DAW.


**Describe alternatives you've considered:**
No idea...


**Additional context:**
I'm using Surge XT standalone in Debian 12 (stable with KDE Plasma) on an used Dell Latitude 7200 2-in-1 (only with touch screen). Surge XT is controlled by a hardware MIDI keyboard Nektar Impact GX61. Audio output over the onboard sound card (phone output) of the Dell Latitude.
It's a killer standalone instrument for < 400,- EUR!!!
(and I'm also using Dexed and other software synths on this cheap but powerful hardware)

items.title: macOS based latency in standalone with audio input

labels.name: macOS
labels.description: macOS related issues

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.x
milestone.description: Things we could do in the 1.x family but didn't make 1.2 or 1.3

items.body:
On macOS 14.x the 1.3 standalone, when input is bound to the MacBook pro microphone (and perhaps other inputs) has a noticeable playback latency independent of output block size.

To test open surge in logic and simultaneously open the standalone. Set the patches an octave apart or so

Setup like this and press a midi key and the logic synth fires meaningfully before the standalone

![Screenshot 2024-02-23 at 8 00 00 AM](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/13387561/3f4820ea-3764-481a-963b-e02cfda49630)

set the standalone input to `<<NONE>>` and the latency disappears

![Screenshot 2024-02-23 at 8 02 04 AM](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/13387561/700e11f8-ac31-457d-b0d0-e5f8cff3a0ae)

So something either in JUCE standalone input handling or our handing of bound input or somewhere along that path is causing the latency to tick up or the block size to explode. Need to ivnestage. Input to none os the workaround for now.

items.title: Channel split is off by one

labels.name: MIDI
labels.description: MIDI support related

labels.name: UX
labels.description: Issues related to user experience (UX) - mouse, touch, keyboard, MIDI inputs, etc.

labels.name: Documentation
labels.description: Improvements or additions to documentation

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.x
milestone.description: Things we could do in the 1.x family but didn't make 1.2 or 1.3

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
The split MIDI channel in Chan Split Scene Mode is off by one. Meaning that if I set the split channel to 8, notes on channels 1-8 are played by Scene A, and channels 9-16 are played by Scene B. The manual at https://surge-synthesizer.github.io/manual-xt/#scene-select-and-scene-mode states "Channel Split Notes from MIDI channels **below** the split MIDI channel will be played by scene A, notes from MIDI channels **above and including** the split MIDI channel will be played by scene B." If that's the intended behaviour, then this is a bug. Or alternately, you could change the manual text to read "below and including" and "above" respectively to match the current behaviour.
As a side note, I'm wondering how this is actually supposed to work if the split channel is set to 1, and if the "above and including" behaviour would be the intended one. This would practically mean that channels 1 and above (literally meaning "all channels") would be played by scene B.
As it is now of course, if you set the split channel to 1, then channel 1 is played by Scene A and channels 2 and above will be played by Scene B.

**Surge XT Version**
* Version: 1.3.1
* Plugin Type: CLAP, VST3
* Bitness: 64-bit

**Computer Information:**
 - OS: Windows 10
 - Host: Reaper
 - Version: 7.11
 - All 64-bit

Marc

items.title: Soft Takeover mode for MIDI learned parameters

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: New feature request

labels.name: MIDI
labels.description: MIDI support related

items.body:
Some MIDI controllers have a 'snap mode' (Faderfox for instance), is this supported by Surge?

The synth or plugin hosts sends MIDI cc values to the controller. When in snap mode, the controller doesn't send MIDI data, until it reached / picked up the value which it got from the synth / host.

Does the standalone version have a MIDI Out? Couldn't test, cause the standalone didn't launch properly on Linux.

items.title: Chord storage/memory

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: New feature request

items.body:
# Chord storage/memory concept and implementation.
## Concept
Chord storage is playing a chord or multiple notes with one key.  
There are several patches that do something similar but use multiple oscillators for multiple notes instead of multiple voices.

Benefits over the current workaround
- It allows you to use all 3 oscillators.
- You can play more than 3 notes per scene.  

Some examples of synths that have this feature 
- Roland Alpha Juno 1/2
- Korg Poly 800
- Novation Ultranova

## Implementation

You first enable chord storage by opening the poly playmode context menu.    
If there isn't a chord stored a popup opens saying to play some notes.  
There will be a button that says record chord.

the chord could be stored in SurgeSceneStorage as a list of integers representing midi notes. 

whenever surge recieves a midi on message it transposes and plays all the notes in the chord.

whenever surge recieves a midi off message it transposes and turns off all the notes in the chord.

---

I might try to make this but I haven't contributed to surge before so who knows how that will go.

items.title: Linux - surge-xt-cli using OSC ignores quit, ^-d, ^-c

labels.name: UX
labels.description: Issues related to user experience (UX) - mouse, touch, keyboard, MIDI inputs, etc.

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

labels.name: OSC
labels.description: Issues related to Open Sound Control (OSC) API

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
When running surge-xt-cli (built from git) and using OSC, typing 'quit' or ^-d or ^-c doesn't exit surge.

**Surge XT Version**
Latest git build (2023-02-01). Also present in 1.3.0.
Ran on aarch64, archlinux

**Reproduction Steps:**
Run Surge:
`./build/surge_xt_products/surge-xt-cli --midi-input=1 --sample-rate=44100 --buffer-size=256 --audio-interface=0.5 --osc-in-port=53820 --osc-out-port=53821`

Now press
`^-d` or '^-c' or type 'quit'

Nothing happens.

**Expected Behavior:**
Surge exits.

**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
Raspberry Pi 4
ArmArchlinux Aarch64

**Additional Information:**
This only happens when OSC is enabled.
(quick edit: it does work on Mac)

Drag and drop patches and 'lastLoadedPatch' corner case

labels.name: UX
labels.description: Issues related to user experience (UX) - mouse, touch, keyboard, MIDI inputs, etc.

labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

labels.name: OSC
labels.description: Issues related to Open Sound Control (OSC) API

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
A 'lastLoadedPatch' variable has been added to Storage, which holds the path of the most recently-loaded patch. Under one exact circumstance, it is not getting set correctly.


Version: Surge XT 1.3.OSC_work.394d75a6
Build: 2024-01-30 @ 07:35:56 on 'MacBook-Pro.local/local' with 'AppleClang-15.0.0.15000100' using JUCE 7.0.5
System: macOS 64-bit Standalone on Apple M2 Pro
Sample Rate: 44.1 kHz / Process block size: 32 samples


**Reproduction Steps:**

- Drag and drop any random .fxp file onto Surge.
- Quit and restart Surge.
- Either query over OSC: '/q/patch' or examine the variable Storage::lastLoadedPatch. It will not display the dropped patch, but some other patch that was loaded previously.


**Expected Behavior:**

If the drag-and-dropped patch still exists at startup, get its path into 'lastLoadedPatch'. (If it does not exist, should lastLoadedPatch be set to 'unknown'?)

The 'lastLoadedPath' variable will need to be streamed to DAW state to fix this.

items.title: Osc work: fixing edge cases in /q/patch OSC query

Should be ready to merge.

items.title: Clean up surge voice dstructor path; fixes windows leak
items.body:
~SurgeVoice was not getting called reliably for voices which were created anew. On windows, since the forumla evaluator contains a std::string and msft allocates that even for empty, that lead to a small per voice leak.

This fixes the issue in two ways

1. It makes sure that the placement new constructor and destructor calls match. Especially since the voice storage is now in a std::array so it is destroyed at exit and constructed at startup, we add two calls to ~SurgeVoice and one to ::SurgeVoice()
2. That string shouldn't be a member anyway. Its only on the lua error path where things are already breaking various realtime rules. So make it a unique ptr and alloc it explicitly only if needed and reset it once consumed

Addresses #7478

items.title: Don't build Lua tests if Lua not available
items.body: Building Surge without Lua using `-DSURGE_SKIP_LUA=ON` results in an error because [UnitTestsLUA.cpp](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/blob/1ddf4df83c642d9da4b16a5d6483732e502275ad/src/surge-testrunner/UnitTestsLUA.cpp) is still compiled and tries to use Lua. Following other files like [LuaSupport.cpp](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/blob/1ddf4df83c642d9da4b16a5d6483732e502275ad/src/common/LuaSupport.cpp#L49), this PR adds a preprocessor guard to check for `HAS_LUA` first.

items.title: Memory leaks in Surge standalone on Windows

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
I get memory leak reports in debug builds  with Visual Studio of Surge standalone on Windows when closing the synth.

**Surge XT Version**
Surge XT 1.3.work.1ddf4df
Build: 2024-01-27 @ 00:37:47 on 'DESKTOP-UG17QSV/local' with 'MSVC-19.21.27702.2' using JUCE 7.0.5
System: Windows 64-bit Standalone on Intel(R) Core(TM) i3-7100U CPU @ 2.40GHz
Sample Rate: 48.0 kHz / Process block size: 32 samples

**Reproduction Steps:**
1. I forked the repo on 2024/01/26, cloned my fork to a local folder, created my own working branch from the main branch and generated the Visual Studio 2019 project files via CMake. 
2.  Then I fired up the generated Surge.sln VS solution file via double-click in Windows Explorer. 
3. In VS, I built the surge-xt/surge_xt_Standalone project in Surge.sln on Windows with Visual Studio 2019 in Debug configuration. To do this, one must right-click on surge-xt_Standalone in the "Solution Explorer" and  click on "Set as StartUp Project". The text of the project name will then become boldface. Make sure that the "Debug" configuration is selected (I think, it should be), 
4. Then I click the "Build+Run" button (the green "Play" button). This will initiate the build and when its done run Surge. 
5. After the Surge GUI has openened, I immediately close it. 

**Expected Behavior:**
 The "Output" window of VS now says (among other things):

> Detected memory leaks!
> Dumping objects ->
> {357844} normal block at 0x000001DB106116A0, 60 bytes long.
>  Data: <            <   > 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 3C 00 00 00 
> {357822} normal block at 0x000001DB10611820, 60 bytes long.
>  Data: <            <   > 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 3C 00 00 00 
> {357800} normal block at 0x000001DB10611BA0, 60 bytes long.
>  Data: <            <   > 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 3C 00 00 00 
> {357778} normal block at 0x000001DB106129A0, 60 bytes long.
>  Data: <            <   > 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 3C 00 00 00 
> {357756} normal block at 0x000001DB10612E20, 60 bytes long.
>  Data: <            <   > 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 3C 00 00 00 
> {357734} normal block at 0x000001DB10612FA0, 60 bytes long.
>  Data: <            <   > 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 3C 00 00 00 
> Object dump complete.

When I do not immediately close the window but play a note and then close the window, I get even more leaked objects:

> Detected memory leaks!
> Dumping objects ->
> {357844} normal block at 0x000001C5FC3D6130, 60 bytes long.
>  Data: <            <   > 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 3C 00 00 00 
> {357822} normal block at 0x000001C5FC3D6B30, 60 bytes long.
>  Data: <            <   > 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 3C 00 00 00 
> {357800} normal block at 0x000001C5FC3D6430, 60 bytes long.
>  Data: <            <   > 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 3C 00 00 00 
> {357778} normal block at 0x000001C5FC3D65B0, 60 bytes long.
>  Data: <            <   > 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 3C 00 00 00 
> {357756} normal block at 0x000001C5FC3D6DB0, 60 bytes long.
>  Data: <            <   > 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 3C 00 00 00 
> {357734} normal block at 0x000001C5FC3D6AB0, 60 bytes long.
>  Data: <            <   > 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 3C 00 00 00 
> {310443} normal block at 0x000001C5FC275180, 16 bytes long.
>  Data: <  s             > F8 ED 73 FA C5 01 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 
> {310442} normal block at 0x000001C5FC275130, 16 bytes long.
>  Data: <  s             > D8 D4 73 FA C5 01 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 
> {310441} normal block at 0x000001C5FC274C80, 16 bytes long.
>  Data: <  s             > B8 BB 73 FA C5 01 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 
> {310440} normal block at 0x000001C5FC275590, 16 bytes long.
>  Data: <  s             > 98 A2 73 FA C5 01 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 
> {310439} normal block at 0x000001C5FC275310, 16 bytes long.
>  Data: <x s             > 78 89 73 FA C5 01 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 
> {310438} normal block at 0x000001C5FC274B90, 16 bytes long.
>  Data: <Xps             > 58 70 73 FA C5 01 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 
> Object dump complete.


**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: Windows 10
 - Host: None (Standalone)


**Additional Information:**
Apparently, the 6 objects of 60 bytes are always leaked and additionally, additional 6 objects of size 16 bytes are leaked for each midi note that has been played. It doesn't matter if the notes are played via the virtual keyboard or a hardware midi keyboard. Trying to figure it out by defining _CRTDBG_MAP_ALLOC to get more detailed information about the leak was unsuccessful because with this macro defined, Surge doesn't compile anymore (when trying to build, 17 projects succeed, 4 fail). This seems to be due to the fact that defining _CRTDBG_MAP_ALLOC will cause standard library function names like malloc, free, etc. to be re-#defined via preprocessor macros which breaks compilation of code that uses these names for some of its own (member) functions. Using these names will cause syntax errors. JUCE does this, see here: https://forum.juce.com/t/conflict-with--crtdbg-map-alloc-visual-studio/6040. Something in the "eurorack.vcxproj" project apparently does this, too.

items.title: Avoid crash on loop handle draw on MSEG node delete
